pageContext.claim: “Congratulations. We have another [caravan]. We stopped the first one. We stopped the second one. I wouldn't say that Tijuana is too happy, but they're happily living in Tijuana right now. And a lot of them have gone back. But we stopped them, but it's very tough. And if we didn't have a wall in those areas, it would have been very hard to stop them. We have the military and we have the Border Patrol; they've done an incredible job.”
pageContext.analysis: The Trump administration definitely did not stop every person travelling as part of the first caravan because of the wall. A recent Washington Post report tells the story of one family who slipped through the border wall to enter the U.S. Plus, it's wrong to suggest that asylum seekers are "happily living in Tijuana." Shelters have been overflowing and resources to support them stretched thin.
